meanings.definition: Macaques: a type of monkey found in Asia and Africa.
meanings.sent1: The macaques in the zoo were swinging from branch to branch.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of macaques playing near the river.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous macaques stole all the bananas from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The ancient temple was filled with the chatter of macaques.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fur of the macaques stood out against the green leaves.

meanings.definition: Macaques: plural form of macaque, referring to multiple monkeys of this species.
meanings.sent1: The researchers observed a troop of macaques grooming each other.
meanings.sent2: The macaques chattered loudly as they searched for food.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous macaques played a game of hide-and-seek with the tourists.
meanings.sent4: The city was bustling with activity, like a bustling group of macaques.
meanings.sent5: The playful antics of the macaques entertained the visitors at the sanctuary.
